snippet: After the accident that killed six students, two independent engineers said they had seen what they considered clear evidence that the balcony that fell in Berkeley, Calif., was ridden with dry rot and decay.
abstract: Families and friends of Irish students who died in balcony collapse in Berkeley, Calif, struggle to come to grips with tragedy that took six young lives and injured several others.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and DOUGLAS DALBY
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Douglas Dalby from Dublin. Mitch Smith contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: After the accident that killed six students, two independent engineers said they had seen what they considered clear evidence that the balcony that fell in Berkeley, Calif., was ridden with dry rot and decay.

headline.main: Amid Grief for Students, a Search for Answers After Balcony Collapse
headline.print_headline: Amid Grief for Students, a Search for Answers After Balcony Collapse
